DOC.brief_summary: Aim # 1 . To investigate efficacy psychoeducational intervention ( PED ) sexual arousal . H1 : Compared control group baseline , PED result significant improvement : - self-reported subjective sexual arousal ; - self-reported genital sensitivity ; - psychophysiological sexual arousal . Aim # 2 . To investigate efficacy PED self-reported orgasm , sexual desire , distress , relationship satisfaction . H2 : Compared control group baseline , PED result significant improvement self-reported orgasmic experience , sexual desire , sexual distress , relationship satisfaction . Aim # 3 . To investigate efficacy PED depressive symptom quality life . H3 : Compared control group baseline , PED result significant improvement self-reported depressive symptom quality life .
DOC.brief_title: Cervical Endometrial Cancer Sexual Health Study
DOC.detailed_description: Whereas relatively research therapy option exist physical treatment sexual dysfunction woman history cervical cancer ( e.g . hormone replacement , surgery ; Denton & Maher , 2003 ) , evidence psychological intervention positive effect sexuality . For example , brief psychoeducational program woman early-stage cervical cancer result significant improvement frequency coital activity ( Capone et al. , 1980 ) , enhance compliance sexual rehabilitation , reduce fear intercourse improve sexual knowledge compare control condition ( Robinson et al. , 1999 ) . Unfortunately , neither study target assessed sexual arousal genital sensation - symptom document problematic distress group woman . There also evidence provide venue woman receive education discus sexual concern follow cervical cancer therapeutic might encourage woman aware sexual rehabilitation capacity change , thus evoke active coping style ( Leenhouts et al. , 2002 ) . Taken together , study suggest psychoeducational intervention feasible significantly improve general domain sexual function , sexual frequency knowledge , cervical cancer survivor . Although directly target psychological construct thought , affect , behaviour , psychological treatment also evoke physiological change . In cervical cancer-related sexual dysfunction psychological physical contributor impairment difficult tease apart , psychoeducational intervention address etiological domain essential . We recently develop 3-session psychoeducational intervention design address physical psychological consequence cervical cancer sexual arousal . The sexual arousal concern report group woman fit criterion Female Sexual Arousal Disorder ( FSAD ) , define Diagnostic Statistical Manual Mental Disorders , 4th Edition , Text Revised ( DSM-IV-TR ) `` persistent recurrent inability attain , maintain completion sexual activity , adequate lubrication-swelling response sexual excitement '' `` disturbance cause mark distress interpersonal difficulty '' ( American Psychiatric Association , 2000 ) . A proportion woman also experience new onset difficulty become subjectively sexually arouse , likely direct result genital arousal difficulty , also due impact cancer hysterectomy psychological function . Despite wide prevalence subjective arousal concern , diagnostic category DSM-IV-TR . However , International Consultation Sexual Dysfunctions , collaboration World Health Organization , suggest `` Subjective Sexual Arousal Disorder '' recognize valid concern ( Basson et al. , 2003 ) . Evidence-based treatment FSAD relate genital subjective arousal difficulty exist , persist distress due untreated sexual dysfunction compromise mental physical health . The content psychoeducational intervention base : - empirically support technique area female sexual dysfunction ( e.g. , sensate focus , challenge maladaptive cognition sexual myth ) ; - discussion gynecological oncologist University Washington usually first-line recipient sexual complaint ; - pilot interview conduct 18 cervical endometrial cancer survivor date .
